name: Reunion at Dawn
description: Young Picard has finally resurfaced, but it's clear he is now the new Locutus of Borg, seizing control of the Collective and sending them to assimilate everything in sight. Free Picard and put an end to the Borg's violent spree.
rules:
-- Unique Klingon Empire, Federation, and Terran Empire Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Worf, D. Troi, Spock, Astrophysicists, or 'Picard and Number One' will provide a bonus to Event Faction Missions.
-- Every Event Faction Mission you succeed at earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Victory Points to unlock Event Threshold Rewards.
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Worf, D. Troi, Spock, Picard and Number One or Astrophysicists
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

screens.text: "I am Locutus of Borg, the new sovereign of the Borg. It is time we return to our true destiny, our pursuit of perfection. Resistance is futile. We will bring every species in the Alpha Quadrant into our midst."

"This is deeply disturbing. Not only has Cadet Picard slipped right in to his older counterpart's place, but I can feel the energies of the entire Borg shifting. Any peaceful intentions disappeared the instant he gave those orders."
"If the Borg desire a war, then we will meet them where they stand. The Klingon Empire will send tremors of terror through every inch of the Collective."

"Do not be so hasty, Klingon. The Borg were our allies until they were corrupted by the integration of their new leader. It is likely that rescuing Locutus will also return the Borg to their previously peaceful state. I think we should prioritize his rescue over bloodshed."
